name: Hotel Riu Palace Tropical Bay

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Riu Tropical Bay in Negril, Jamaica, from November 23-30, 2005. (This review is late! Sorry!) The following is a summary our experiences and impressions of the resort and nearby areas.
reviews.title: You can do better than this.
Ate Like A Pig!
reviews.text: ABOUT US: My husband is 33 and I am 32. We have been married 1.5 years, no kids, and are members of the Palace Premier Club, which we joined 6 months ago at the Aventura Palace. My husband is a self-employed small business owner and I am an attorney. Both of us have traveled extensively for work and pleasure to places including Hawaii (several times), Mexico (Cancun, PV, Mazatlan), Canada, Dominican Republic, Europe, and 49 of the 50 states. We live in Las Vegas, Nevada. I am a “luxury snob” while my husband is a Motel 6 kind of guy.

reviews.title: Discrimination
reviews.text: THE HOTEL: We arrived at about 11:00 a.m., taking the red eye from las Vegas to Miami and then a morning flight from Miami to Montego Bay. After a longer-than-expected wait at Sangster Airport to go through customs and a shorter-than-expected ride to Negril, we checked in. The hotel was more crowded than I thought it would be, and there were lots of kids around. Way too many kids for a hotel that markets itself to couples and adults. There is nothing really for them to do except take up valuable space at the swim-up bar. There is an internet terminal in the lobby which costs $9 for 30 minutes. There is no Jacuzzi, only a pool.

reviews.title: Black people stay away.
reviews.text: THE ROOMS: Our room was on the third floor. There are no elevators, which is okay if you don’t mind walking. Take bug repellant and don’t leave any soda bottles out. The bed in the “king” room is weird. It is two double beds pushed together. If you sleep in the middle of the bed, it will come apart and you will wind up on the floor at some period during the night. If you like to read on your balcony take a flashlight. There are no outdoor lights on the balconies.

THE FOOD: The jerk hut was really good. Ricardo that runs the jerk hut is awesome. Don’t waste your time standing in line for the restaurants that require reservations. It is not worth it. We went to Sir Anthony’s and it was not any better than the buffet. I think the soup was Campbell’s and it was cold. The buffet is all right. I have seen better and worse. This hotel does not have room service.
reviews.title: It was "Irie"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We originally planned to stay at the Riu Negril before getting "upgraded" to the Riu Palace Tropical Bay. Our room at the Riu Negril had some issues such as mold on the matress/boxspring, lack of working AC and it had a strong unpleasant odor probably from the mildew. So, after getting the run-around we were transferred on day 3 by our Apple Rep.
reviews.title: Jusk Ok

reviews.text: ROOMS:
reviews.title: Great Resort, Awesome Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived to a room that unfortunately smelled worse than the first room and the AC there didn't work either. It did however, have a nice plasma TV, but it didn't turn on because there was no power cord. So, we called and asked if someone could fix our TV and look at our AC. The maintenance man came and said to fix the AC would be very messy so he suggested we move rooms. So finally, after 3 rooms in as many days, we found one that didn't smell, very exciting. However, the AC didn't work and at that point we just gave up and settled for humidty. We did mention it to the front desk and they may have tried to fix it but didn't work. Oh well. The maids did do a nice job cleaning and the mini bar was stocked when necessary. The beds were fine, no problems getting plenty of sleep, besides being sticky and sweaty from humidity.
reviews.title: Great resort but....not a five star!!

reviews.text: Food:
reviews.title: A LITTLE TASTE OF PARADISE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't bother with the reservations since the food in the "gourmet" resturants usually aren't much better than the buffetts in most cases. There was plenty to chose from and we never went away hungry. The grilled chicken on the beach was the best tasting food by far. We've had better breakfasts at other AIs but again, we always found something to fill us up. I was very disappointed with the coffee. I was told they served Blue Mountain Coffee but it was too watered down to tell....this was the case every day.
reviews.title: Second time back - even better than first.
Best Beach and water in Bloody Bay
reviews.text: My husband and I went to the Riu Palace from Feb 18 thru the 26th and have never been treated so well or had such a great experience. We love to travel and what set this hotel apart was the employees were genuinely happy to work there. The beach area is so lush with palm trees and fine sand. When you walked to any of the other hotels nothing was as nice for water calmness or features such as lunch served at the jerk hut or on the beach daily. Jamaica is just amazing in itself but this hotel and all its staff made it fabulous. It was very safe and you could leave your belonging on your beach chair all day with no worries about anything being messed with. Bring your own insulated cup to enjoy the great drinks and leave your worries behind. Go as soon as you can...we are already saving up to go again!!

reviews.title: Perfect Place to Recharge the Battery
reviews.text: Mark and Teresa Dale, LeClaire Iowa

reviews.title: Pretty compact, but good quality resort!
reviews.text: Let's put it this way....if we could go back today, my wife and I would do it in a heartbeat. The place is another high quality Riu Hotel/Resort property. We've been to many places in Mexico and the Caribbean and this place is one of the best. The best thing of all was the staff, from the front counter, to the maids, to the bartenders, to the restaurant staff, it was exceptional. Everyone was more than happy to make you at home. The beach is like powdered sugar, the water is crystal clear, and the sun is hot! Most days there were clouds to provide a bit of shade, and one day it rained, but overall the weather was great. The restaurants, all of them included, were very good. The buffet was very good. If you can't find something good to eat here, you got a problem. There is selection, selection, selection. The drinks all around were the bomb. Try a Dirty Monkey and you will certainly be trying them again! The place is all granite and marble and is very well kept up. The entertainment is kinda cheesy but they work darn hard to make you laugh and have a good time at night. You can't go wrong selecting this place for your winter vacation.

reviews.title: 4th visit to RIU (Palace) Tropical Bay...still love it!
reviews.text: This riu has many rooms but the grounds aren't huge. The restos and such are big though, so no space issues.

reviews.title: Beautiful resort, beach, ocean, etc.
reviews.text: Check in was easy enough, we got our ocean view room. Room is decent, of course the 2 beds together. The mini bar and drinks are good, tv channels too. Room is basic but fine.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back Monday, March 2nd Had a ball!! It was our first time in Jamaica and it won't be our last. If you are like us you will go OH no they wrote a book. But there is a lot of good info if you can handle it. The resort was top notch. The room was great, we got a ocean view room which I would highly recommend it's worth the upgrade. Room service was awesome and included. The resort is spotless they clean constantly. Drinks are good and plentiful. The pool bar staff are friendly and fun.
reviews.title: Loved it, we will be back!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was what you would expect at an all-inclusive good not great with the exception of the jerk hut and the japanese resturant. The sushi was yummy!!! Breakfast at the buffet was very good. Like other reviews I agree that the process they use to get into the ala carte resturants is crazy. Get down there and stand in line for 45 minutes to get a number only to go back an hour later to make your reservation. There has to be a better way.
reviews.title: Perfect, Relaxing Honeymoon... Can't wait to return!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would highly recommend a couple of tours. The first is there is a snorkeling trip that you can sign up for right by the pool. You have the choice of two 45 minute snorkeling stops or one and a stop at an island where you can pick out a lobster and they will cook it up on a wood fire. We opted for the second. The boat ride which goes from right at the hotel is only 15 minutes. The snorkeling was very nice. The lobster which costs $15 to $20 USD was unbelievable. It is quite rustic as you get it on a paper plate no utensils. But it was very sweet and actually the very best lobster we have had (really), The cost of the trip is $65 USD for two people. Just do it.
reviews.title: Loved the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The other thing we did was not actually a tour. We hired [-] it was $120.00 USD for as long as desired. We went to YS falls which is about a two hour drive. We did the zip line which was really cool. We had the good fortune of Clive himself taking us. He is a wealth of knowledge and gave us quite a lesson regarding both history and geography of Jamaica..
reviews.title: absolutely delightful...fabulous place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the way back we stopped at a little restaurant in Belmont (very rustic real Jamaica). We had the steamed snapper with potatoes carrots & crackers. It was the best meal we had on the trip although the lobster was a close second.
reviews.title: Simply Paradise

reviews.text: Traveled many times to Negril, first stay at Riu Tropical Bay. I have never stayed in a room that was so hot (as in really warm)! We had a corner suite on third floor and when we checked in it was like a sauna. Incorrectly assumed that air was turned off and would cool down in an hour or so. This didn't happen,so we went to the front desk where we were told that the maintenance man would check it out. That never happened that day, so we spent the first night sweating in bed, unable to sleep. Next morning we went to front desk again and asked to see different rooms.... All of them were equally as hot. Tried to change hotels but all sold out except Grand Lido (stayed there before) but they would not allow our 14 year old son (16 years is the minimum). Every guest we spoke to said their rooms were like furnaces and nothing could be done. One of the hotel personnel told us that they "turned air conditioning off in the afternoon for a couple of hours and in the middle of the night for a couple of hours, to save energy"... Anyone planning to travel to Jamaica in the summer might want to rethink where they stay.
reviews.title: Baked in our room
Could be great... But management won't allow it.
reviews.text: The pools were so dirty and foul smelling we didn't go in them at all.

reviews.title: Great vacation!
reviews.text: Food was moderate.

reviews.title: Wonderful !!
reviews.text: Really bad (cheap) selections of beverages in room (no Red Stripe) they had "Real Rock Beer" (not good) and unidentifiable sodas. They finally added some Pepsi and Diet Pepsi.

reviews.title: Fantastic Family Holiday
reviews.text: The beach at the Riu Tropical Bay was fabulous so we spent as much time there as possible. Bring a cheap raft as this hotel does not offer floats of any kind.

reviews.title: Just Back from Riu PalaceTropical Bay
reviews.text: We returned home Feb. 13th . We have been here several times since they opened this hotel and I have to say the service was outstanding. There are a few of the regular staff still working there, but most of them are new. What I came to find out was that about half of the staff is not Jamaican! I couldn't believe that they could take work from the Jamaican people. As I said the service was outstanding, if you needed anything, it was taken care of within 5 minutes. Nothing like it used to be, where you considered yourself lucky if you received it before you left! However, for the first time, we really didn't feel as if we were in Jamaica. The staff used to sing and laugh and joke around all the time. Now, it's just service with a smile. I am so disappointed in the atmosphere that we probably will not return. The music they play on the beach is mostly hip-hop latino music. I'm sorry, but if I'm in Spain, then I'd expect to hear Spanish music. When I'm in the Caribbean, I want to hear Caribbean music. We like to lay on the beach and relax, and it was hard to relax with that constant banging music. Also, I think the staff they brought in are from the Dominican Republic. When they would talk to each other, they spoke in Spanish. At first glance they look like Jamaicans, and we were fooled for the first day. Also, the resort no longer has the Jamaican soda, Ting. The rooms are all done being renovated. Mostly, they changed the floor tile and the bathroom sink, toliet and counters. The beds used to be two double beds pushed together. Now, they have a weird size ! It's smaller than a double, but bigger than a twin. They push them together, but it just doesn't work . They constantly pull away from each other even if you just bump it when you walk. The sheets were really soft, much higher thread count than before. The housekeeping staff was wonderful! They brought clean towels every evening and checked if you needed anything. The beach was gorgeous as usual! The food was also good. Ricardo is still at the Jerk Hut so that was welcome news! The buffet was good, but some nights, it just didn't seem to have the variety that they used to. We ate at the Japanese restaurant, which we had always liked, but this time it was very mediocre. The Steakhouse was fantastic though! Much better than last year even! The filet mignon was really thick and very high quality and the lobster ( half a tail) was also good. The resort seemed only half full till the last few days we were there, but it still wasn't full to capacity. The pools were clean and the only change I noticed in the pool was they added mosaic tile loungers in the water which were not at all comfortable! They also expanded the bar that is actually in the water adding several barstools,but the bar above was the same size and overcrowded. Crazy Diana is still there! Yeah! The pizza restaurant is gone . They put a really nice bar in that spot. You can get drinks up there in the morning before the pool bar opens. It's a great place to wait for your bus back to the airport. Oh! The liquor is actually name brand liquor! That's a big change for them since they made it a Palace. You can also order room service, although the menu is VERY limited. We ordered a sandwich and dessert one night, and the food was there in 20 minutes! The guy was out of breath, like her was running to the room with it. So, all in all, the resort has made some serious upgrades, but at what cost? The Spanish influence is spreading throughout the island, as I noticed at the airport the signs were in both English and Spanish. I was told by one of the Jamaicans, that it is now mandatory to teach Spanish in the schools. It's like they are taking away the Jamaican identity. One of the buffet theme nights is Mexican. Two new restaurants have been added, one is Krystal( a fusion restaurant), and the other is Italian. We looked at the menu and it didn't look like real Italian food, so we skipped it. Other people were not impressed either. I think I covered everything. Oh, they have 4 new computers if you want to do e-mail. $9 for 30 min and they work faster than the old ones they had. However, they were down twice, once was a server problem, the other was the computers. If you have a laptop, the wireless is free! Hope this helps anyone who is going there.!

reviews.title: Gorgeous resort
reviews.text: Our recent stay at the Riu Palace was excellent.

reviews.title: Perfect for relaxing and being lazy
reviews.text: Travelling to and from the resort was a breeze. We used Chickens Magic Bus for airport transportation. He is on time, dependable, reliable, highly recommended, and the cost is the best that we've found ($60 for two of us each way.) http://chickensmagicbus.com/ He has a very comfortable small bus and says he has been doing this for 25 years.

reviews.title: Every Ting's Irie!
reviews.text: The resort itself was recently renovated, so the place was pristine. The grounds were impeccably maintained, the powdery beach was raked every day and the small army of staff made sure everyone was well taken care of.

reviews.title: not a five star, but very nice mostly
reviews.text: The room we stayed in had a balcony and two chairs overlooking the water. It was worth the upgrade. The room was large, and had beautiful tile and marble throughout. The only weird thing was that the king bed was actually (2) full sized beds pushed together.

reviews.title: Honeymoon of a lifetime!
reviews.text: I feel that I should write a review as being as we spent the whole nine months before our honeymoon reading the reviews on this site. Everyone is entitiled to their opinion, and I must say, we were slightly worried after reading some of the negative reviews. However from the moment we stepped off the plane in Montego Bay, to the moment we got on the plane again 7 days later, we can only say positive things about Jamaica and about the Riu Tropical Bay Hotel. The grand reception area is the so beautiful. We were greated with a glass of rum punch and were shown to our room. After an hour or so, the hotel delivered a lovely basket of fruit and a bottle of rum with a note from the hotel wishing us an unforgettable honeymoon. The room was lovely and clean and very spacious. Our maid, Paula cleaned our room every day and restocked our mini bar for us. The pools were nice, although we chose to sit by the sea rather than by the pool. The food was really nice. Im a very picky eater but always managed to find something to enjoy each meal time. The staff were all great. They were always smiling and nothing is too much trouble. Everything is No Problem Mon!! The entertainment staff work so hard. They had us in stitches with their quirky dance routines and hilarious games etc. Hi to Mini Me!! The only semi-negative thing we can say is that the Jamaican's dont rush to do anything!! We loved every minute of our honeymoon and we are already planning our next holiday to the Riu Tropical Bay for 2007.

This was my second time back to the Riu Tropical Bay, I just got back today and I'm glad to be home. The rain ruined most of our week. It rained 4 1/2 of the 7 days we were there. We paid for Run of the house and when we got to the lobby I gave the guy at the reception $20US to hook us up in a ocean view room which he did. The view was spectacular, but I was unhappy with the service this time around. The A/C unit in our room barely cooled it. I must have called 5 times to have maintenance fix it, but nobody came. Then I went to the reception desk and the offered to switch our room to the room right next to us. Before moving our stuff I tried the A/C unit in that room and it was the same. I think both rooms shared the same unit, so I never switched rooms - Thankfully, the room wasn't too hot due to all the rain cooling it off. I have never seen so much rain in my life. I was also annoyed that the day before we left nobody came to clean our room. This trip was unlike our first trip back in August of 2004 - It seems like there was a change in management. I felt ignored by the bar tenders, waiters, and staff - most of the time I would ask my boyfriend to order the drinks because I hated having to flag down the bar tenders. The food was OK nothing great - on my first trip I thought the food was great. We went to Sir Anthony's which was good and the Japanese restaurant which I didn't care for.
reviews.title: Just Got Back- 2nd Time
Was a horrible experience, I wouldn't recommend this place to my worst enemy!
reviews.text: The beach was good, but there were sand fleas which would cover your body in minutes. I had to keep jumping in the water. The water was nice and clear. I stayed by the pool most of the time due to the bugs. I did see a landscaper spraying bug spray one day and the next day it seemed better.

My boyfirend and I brought our own snorkling gear and planned to kayak over to a small island by Hedo II - we had done this in the past and saw some nice fish. We waited with our gear for about 30 minuted until a double kayak came back (there was only one for the entire resort and only two single kayaks for the entire resort) the guys who were working at the water sports saw us waiting for the kayak and when it came in they told us we couldn't take our snorkle gear with us. When I asked why they said because the boss said so. I asked to speak to the boss and they told me he wasn't there. They didn't want us to go on the kayak because they wouldn't make any money off us. They charge $20US per person to go on the snorkling trip which is to the same spot - about 5 minutes from the resort. I was extremely upset at this and din't do any other water sports due to the way which we were treated.
reviews.title: Nice hotel....terrible nightly entertainment

reviews.text: Overall I would rate this resort a three star at most. The first time I went to RTB we had such a great time, maybe it would have been best not to return to such a bad experience. I truly hope management reads these reviews. The is a lot to improve at this resort and I don't plan to return any time soon.
reviews.title: Our stay at the RIU Tropical Bay
Great holiday in a great location
reviews.text: We stayed at the Tropical Bay for our son's wedding and what a great choice they made !

reviews.title: Great vacation and Great Value
reviews.text: You may read some negative comments in these reviews but bare in mind they are not generally from the English visitors. I mention this as we experienced a lot of rude people when ordering drinks from the bar or talking (down) to the maids. Visitors from other areas of the world seem to expect a "Ritz" type service on a package holiday. We felt for the amount we paid we got superb value for money. Mannners cost nothing and a simple "please" when ordering makes all the difference. I would not be at my best if I was spoken to in the ways in which heard. A lot seems to be made also with regard to "Bugs" etc. This is a tropical island and funnily enough there are cockroaches. We saw a few a night,. So what, they were there first and none of them attacked us so we didn't feel it was a problem. Out of a party of 16 of us no one saw any "bugs" in their rooms. We were in room 1313 top floor near the water sports end of the hotel and it was fine.
The rooms were cleaned daily and we could not fault this. The maids were charming and friendly.
reviews.title: Relaxing Vacation

reviews.text: I defy anyone to fault the food. The buffet has so much choice and the quality of the food was great. We also sampled all three resturants, Sir Antonys, The Steak House and the Japanese. All three were first rate. Booking at 10 am each day is required but a fair system and no problem.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel
Dont bother mon
reviews.text: The beach is one of the best we have encountered. Plenty of sunbeds, safe bathing in a clear blue sea and some good snorkling.

aka: Riu Palace Tropical Bay Hotel Negril
description: * Renovated in summer 2008 * Located in Negril, on Jamaica's west coast * On the beachfront * Complimentary sun loungers on the beach * 1-storey main building and 2-storey buildings * Victorian-style architecture * Surrounded by 47,000 m2 / 56,500 sq. yards of lush gardens * 7.5 km / 4.7 miles from Negril West End * 6 km / 3.8 miles from various shops * 80 km / 48 miles from Montego Bay airport
